message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.DS

The paper deals with message authentication codes (MACs) in resource-constrained networks, which is a topic that falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper specifically mentions two types of networks: low-power wide-area network and in-vehicle controller area network, which are both subcategories of computer networks (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the use of MACs in industrial control systems, which is a subcategory of control systems (cs.SY). The paper proposes a novel approach for message authentication that involves encoding and decoding procedures, which is a topic that falls under the category of information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed approach using simulations and a prototype implementation, which involves data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
